alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Laramie Range; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 6:24PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Albany County through 700 PM MDT... At 624 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Wheatland Reservoir 3 to Bosler. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bosler and Baldy Peak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Laramie Range; South Laramie Range
